abstract: The attorney general of New York sued a fund-of-funds unit of Bank of New York Mellon over the $227 million in investor losses tied to Bernard L. Madoff.
snippet: The attorney general of New York sued a fund-of-funds unit of Bank of New York Mellon over the $227 million in investor losses tied to Bernard L. Madoff.
lead_paragraph: 3:32 p.m. | Updated Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo of New York on Tuesday sued a fund-of-funds unit of Bank of New York Mellon for fraud over the $227 million that the unit’s investors had lost as a result of its investment in Bernard L. Madoff‘s Ponzi scheme.

headline.main: Cuomo Sues Bank of New York Unit Over Madoff
